title: Senior SW Developer/Team Technical Lead (Java/AWS/Microservices transition)
description:
For our Integrations team in Helsinki we are looking for a Senior Software Developer/Team Technical Lead. You will be part of the Integrations team at Paf and will work with complex software integrations in an easy-going, collaborative and informal atmosphere. You will collaborate with experienced developers and architects to develop and improve the Paf systems. We actively discuss, plan and share knowledge within and outside the team. We handle the 3rd party game integrations.

You will lead the work in one of our scrum teams and actively communicate with 3rd party suppliers and partners. You will contribute to the whole system development chain from requirement analysis to design, implementation and quality assurance. Your focus will be in developing new integrations and tools, as well as maintain our current solutions.

We are in the middle of moving from a hardware-based infrastructure, to a cloud-based, microservice based architecture, so you will get the chance to start to learn about our legacy system, develop our offers and yourself, and be a part of our journey into the future.

What’s in it for you?

You will join an agile cross-functional development team in our office in central Helsinki. You get to work with the latest in microservices and container technologies and on all parts of the technology stack. You will learn new things and grow as a professional, especially in mentoring junior talent. We value diversity in our multicultural workplace and look positively on a gender equal workplace. In addition to a competitive salary, we also offer a benefits package with lunch coupons, sports benefits, occupational healthcare with extra insurance and more.

What skills are needed?

We are looking for skilled professionals with serious experience, for this role, we would like you to have:

  • 8+ years of software development and software design with industry experience in shipping and maintaining products

  • 5+ years of experience with Java and SpringBoot

  • 5+ years of experience with Docker, Rancher, Swagger

  • 5+ years of experience with web technologies such as SOAP, JS, HTML5, CSS, REST, and modern open-source web frameworks

  • 5+ years of experience in working with Agile methods, preferably Scrum

  • 3+ years of experience with Microservice Architecture

  • 3+ years of experience with transaction centric systems

  • Experience in Gatling, Jenkins, GIT and Bitbucket

  • Experience in PostgreSQL

  • Good communication skills in English. Swedish and/or Finnish is a merit. Excellent interpersonal skills, as mentoring is a requirement, and proactive in involving internal and external people

  • Understanding of business as the driving force for development

  • An attitude of flexibility and perseverance to get stuff done

  • Ability to see the bigger picture

Nice to have:

  • Experience on mobile, HTML5, VueJS etc.

  • SCALA and Gatling programming skills

Interested? Submit your application on-line by March 3rd, 2019. All communication and applications will be treated confidentially. For more information, please contact our recruitment partner Arja Martikainen arja.martikainen(at)barona.fi or call +358 40 7621564 Tue-Thu between 2 and 3 pm.

title: Senior Lead Engineer
description:
Tamedia is the leading private media group in Switzerland. The company was founded in 1893 and today employs a staff of approximately 3,400 in Switzerland, Austria, Denmark, France, Germany, Israel, Luxembourg and Serbia. It has been traded at the Swiss stock exchange since 2000.

Tamedia is the shareholder of some of Switzerland's most well known Digital Brands, including 20min, JobCloud (jobs.ch), Homegate, Tutti, Ricardo, Doodle or Zattoo. The combined audience on web and mobile represents almost 50% of the measured Internet traffic in Switzerland. As such Tamedia plays an active role in supporting and guiding these companies to further success. We are a small team of veteran software engineers, providing consulting, services and systems across the Tamedia group. We report directly to the Group CTO, where we are responsible for setting the strategic direction for technology at Tamedia. This includes building and maintaining centralized, highly available and mission critical services for some of the biggest mobile and web audiences in Switzerland and also involves building and coaching of great engineering teams. Our main office is located in Zürich, with an Engineering Center in Belgrade.

In Tamedia’s Core Engineering team you work on the most demanding group-wide tech-projects and consult the large Tamedia portfolio in engineering and tech management projects. You are part of a small team of veteran engineering leads, facing challenging projects and solving hard problems connected to delivering high quality products within the largest cluster of successful Swiss digital companies. Your leadership and interpersonal skills will be just as important as your planning and technical skills.

What you'll do:

  • Lead projects with a major impact across the Tamedia group, used by millions of users every day
  • Consult with and support Tamedia group companies to help them overcome engineering, product and leadership challenges and grow into more mature organisations
  • Support Tamedia Ventures in due diligence activities, as we explore investment opportunities
  • Participate in organising activities that build a “digital culture” at Tamedia, such as the annual TX Conference, hackdays, education initiatives and similar
  • Incubate new ideas and innovation by building prototypes and proof-of-concepts
  • Work in a highly experienced team that favors hands-on over indirect action
  • Dive into difficult problems and successfully deliver results on schedule

We are looking for:

  • At least 10+ years of experience building, scaling and maintaining production systems
  • Deep understanding of the full software and product development lifecycle, from UX and design through to deployment into production and phase-out
  • Experience working on B2C platforms with large user bases (where “large” is proportional to the population of Switzerland)
  • Development experience in backend, frontend and mobile (or at least 2 of 3)
  • Professional experience working with multiple programming languages
  • Experience with the range of typical backend systems such a all kinds of datastores, queues, search engines and similar
  • Familiarity with cloud environments such as AWS and Google Cloud
  • Strong experience in SOA environments, APIs, services, architectures
  • Experience with containers, Kubernetes, continuous deployment and testing
  • Excellent communication skills - f2f, documentation, presentations and conference-calls
  • Team leadership and management experience. Alternatively examples of where you played a leading role on a project where multiple engineers were involved.
  • A degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
  • Fluent in English, solid written and spoken German
  • A healthy aversion to deploying on Fridays or after 16:00
  • A natural instinct to avoid listening to Phil Collins

What you can expect from us:

  • Very strong and dedicated engineering team as your peers.
  • We value personal improvement and support you in expanding your knowledge with courses and conferences
  • A thriving engineering culture with hackdays, conferences, 3D printers, soldering stations and an always open ear to leftfield ideas.
  • Modern workplace with the best tools money can buy in downtown Zürich.
  • On-site canteen with plentiful selection of fresh food and salad. And Currywurst.
  • Travel opportunities to our offices around Europe (e.g. Engineering Center in Belgrade) .

We do not accept unsolicited CVs from Third Party Agencies.

title: Frontend-utvikler
description:
Er du utvikler som ønsker å bekjempe tidstyver sammen med Enable AS?

Ønsker du å kickstarte din utviklerkarriere? Elsker du å utvikle responsive og brukervennlige løsninger? Da kan du være Enables nye superhelt!

Informasjon om stillingen I samarbeid med Enable ser vi i Academic Work etter en engasjert utvikler!

I rollen som tidstyvbekjemper hos Enable vil du ha en variert og utfordrende hverdag. Her vil du jobbe som frontendutvikler i samarbeid med dyktige kolleger i prosjektbaserte og tverrfaglige team. Enable er kjent for å ha ansatte med spisskompetanse innen både installasjon/oppgradering, konfigurering av løsninger samt utvikling på Office 365 og SharePoint. Nå har du mulighet til å bli en del av teamet. Dine arbeidsoppgaver innebærer blant annet:

Frontendutvikling mot skyløsninger

  • Ta del i kreative prosjekter (workshop hos kunde, utarbeide kravprofil m.m.)
  • Videreutvikling og optimalisering av løpende prosjekter og eksisterende løsninger

Helter i kampen mot tidstyvene. Det er Enable. Tidstyver trives når systemer og programmer ikke snakker sammen. Enable tror på standardiserte IT-produkter, ikke standardiserte mennesker eller virksomheter.

Hos Enable er de opptatt av å være ledende på kultur og arbeidsmiljø. For å opprettholde det gode arbeidsmiljøet arrangeres det jevnlig sosiale sammenkomster for medarbeiderne i Enable, og det settes av mye ressurser til kompetanseheving gjennom kursing, sertifisering, konferanser og andre aktiviteter.

Enable er et solid selskap med mange spennende prosjekter og kunder, og Enable sin ekspertise og engasjement gjør at de sitter med mange fantastiske referanser. Deriblant fra Kjell Bratlien, Prosjektleder for storviltportalen (Statskog):

"Det har vært helt fenomenalt å jobbe med Enable. De har dyktige og samarbeidsorienterte medarbeidere som har jobbet raskt og effektivt. Dette prosjektet har dermed blitt en ubetinget suksess både for oss og for jegerne."

Enable ser etter deg som har engasjement for utvikling og som elsker å bidra til fellesskapet. Det innebærer at du er opptatt av kompetansedeling og du spiller dine medarbeidere gode. Du legger ned en innsats for å skape gode samarbeid og du skaper gode kunderelasjoner. Du er i tillegg veldig interessert i egen utvikling, og som person er du arbeider du selvstendig og strukturert. Du planlegger, organiserer og prioriterer arbeidet ditt effektivt.

Om du har relevant erfaring innen programmering og frontendutvikling gjennom studier, frivillige verv eller arbeid så er det en stor fordel. Det er viktig at du i tillegg ønsker å bidra til Enable sin kultur som fokuserer på åpenhet, kompetanse og trivsel.

Oppsummert tror vi dette vil være viktig

  • Relevant høyere utdannelse (innen for eksempel informatikk, programmering, spillutvikling m.m.)
  • God erfaring med bruken av JavaScript og i tillegg kjennskap til Typescript
  • Kjennskap til teknologier som C#, .Net og Microsoft Azure
  • En lidenskap for utvikling og ønsker en karriere innen frontendutvikling
  • God kjennskap til moderne rammeverk for utvikling (som for eksempel react)
  • Kommuniserer og samarbeider godt med andre, på norsk og engelsk, både muntlig og skriftlig

Annet Oppstart: Etter avtale, senest august 2019 Omfang: 100% Sted: Klæbuveien 194, 7037 Trondheim Søknadsfrist: 15. mars 2019

Vi vil vurdere søknader fortløpende og anbefaler derfor å sende inn en søknad så snart som mulig. Uavhengig av utfall, vil vi oppdatere deg om fremdrift etter søknadsfristens utløp. Denne rekrutteringen gjennomføres av Academic Work, men du vil bli fast ansatt hos Enable.

Informasjon om bedriften Enable er et konsulentselskap tilknyttet informasjonsteknologi. De har som visjon å være kundens helter i kampen mot tidstyvene og ønsker å være med å skape kundens egne helter. Med høy produktkvalitet og kompetanse gir Enable sine kunder gode og lønnsomme løsninger. Her vil du bli en del av et fagmiljø med engasjerte medarbeidere som har stort fokus på kompetanseheving og kultur.

Når tidstyvene er borte, blir det mer tid igjen til de oppgavene som løser problemer, og som fører oss nærmere målene.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
EMBEDDED SOFTWARE ENGINEER

Machinebouw - Ervaren professional

Regio: Deventer of Eindhoven

Wil jij je Embedded kennis en ervaring inzetten in de smart systems ontwikkelingen binnen Industry 4.0? Binnen de unit Machine and Systems kun je gaan werken aan divers scala aan projecten in multidisciplinaire teams, waarin je zal samenwerken met o.a. hardware- en mechanical engineers. Zo kun je bijvoorbeeld werken aan energiezuinige devices met weinig geheugen en opslag (zoals sensortoepassingen met een ingebouwde microcontroller), maar ook met high-performance multicore embedded devices voor hightech klanten zoals Philips en ASML. Na je start bij ICT, zul je gaan werken aan verschillende projecten bij diverse klanten bij jou in de regio. De projectduur ligt tussen de 3 maanden en 2 jaar, afhankelijk van de klant en het soort project.

Wij zijn op zoek naar een embedded software engineer die graag real-time applicaties maakt met embedded besturingssystemen zoals Linux, VxWorks of RTOS, maar ook net zo lief low level baremetal werkt. Je vindt het leuk om low level embedded applicaties te bouwen voor next generation IoT embedded devices, maar ook code optimalisatie met moderne compilers als GCC, LLVM en Clang klinkt jou als muziek in de oren.

Verder:

  • ben je goed op de hoogte van de laatste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van technische software. Je weet de mogelijkheden op waarde te schatten en goed te implementeren
  • ben je actief in de innovatieve machine- en apparatenbouw en systeemintegratie
  • krijg je de ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen binnen ICT
  • je gaat aan de slag bij opdrachtgevers in jouw regio (Noord-Oost of Zuid Nederland, afhankelijk van jouw woonplaats).

Wat vragen wij van jou?

  • Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Embedded Software Engineer
  • Een afgeronde HBO of WO-opleiding in een relevante technische richting
  • Ervaring met low level assembly, C, C++ en device drivers
  • Ervaring met scripting talen zoals GNU Bash, Python en Perl
  • Affiniteit met machinebouw
  • Kennis van computersysteemarchitecturen, zoals ARM
  • Basiskennis van elektronica (bijvoorbeeld oscilloscoop, solderen) is een pré
  • Goede communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands en Engels
  • Een geldig rijbewijs

Heb jij een groot deel van het bovenstaande afgevinkt? Dan heten wij jou enorm graag welkom bij onze ICT family!

Dit hebben wij jou te bieden:

  • Goed salaris: je ontvangt een goed marktconform salaris
  • 13e maand: elk jaar een extra maandloon
  • 29 vakantiedagen: met de vrijheid om dagen bij of te verkopen
  • Pensioenregeling: een goede regeling voor je oude dag
  • Leaseauto: of een vergoeding voor je eigen auto
  • Onkostenvergoeding: een netto bijdrage in werkgerelateerde kosten
  • Opleidingen: leer de nieuwste technieken in onze ICT Academy
  • Boekenbudget: koop een boek of devkit voor jezelf

Interesse?

Solliciteer online via de 'Solliciteer' button.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: Sr. Android Engineer (Java/Kotlin) (m/f/x)
description:
The Android client we develop is used by our Germany wide workforce and is key to the digitization of the energy business. It’s an enterprise-grade application which connects to our backend services. The code base is written in Native Java and a bit of Kotlin and our entire stack is up to date. Our main data store is GreenDAO but moving slowly to Firebase's Cloud Firestore. Our business is constantly growing and changing. New feature requests or requirement changes may emerge every day. As a result we build software that is highly maintainable and scalable to satisfy those needs.

Your job will be to work in small teams on independent projects alongside your non technical colleagues. You will analyze our business needs and implement solutions while maintaining a high quality standard and developing at startup speed. You will have the freedom to use any tools and resources to achieve your goals. We look forward to learn from your experiences and share ours with you.

You can find out more about our software engineering team at: https://thermondo.github.io/

Your profile

  • hands on Java/Kotlin experience with the native Android APIs
  • a feeling of pride and ownership for your products
  • hands on experience with quality assurance and automated tests
  • ideally familiarity with GreenDAO and Firebase
  • strong understanding of functional programming aspects used by RxJava or Kotlin coroutines
  • experience with JavaScript and Python is a plus
  • fluent in English (German is a plus)

What we offer

  • a solid base salary plus perks
  • flexible working hours
  • the chance to become a full stack engineer and a polyglot developer
  • a great career track in Berlin’s “hottest” startup
  • meaning – Our work has a direct impact on the German energy market
  • paid educational leave incl. a conference budget
  • freedom to contribute to the open source community

title: Android Engineer [Open to Remote]
description:
The projects on our plate are amazing, and we're looking for talented people to meet the exciting technical challenges we face. We're looking for an experienced Android Engineer to contribute to the continual improvement of the Paktor experience for our users. We're open to your ideas for cool interactions and interesting ways to bring people together. The best ideas - from any source - are acted on quickly here. If you're an intelligent and highly ambitious entrepreneur, we want to talk to you!

Responsibilities:

  • Design and build advanced applications for the Android platform
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
  • Work with outside data sources and APIs
  • Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability
  • Work on bug fixing and improving application performance
  • Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency

Requirements:

  • Minimum 5 years in total IT experience which includes at least 3-4 years in Android
  • Deep understanding of Android framework
  • Experience with Android Studio, Git, Gradle, Dagger, RxJava, Firebase
  • Working knowledge of different architectures such as MVP and MVVM
  • Hands-on experience on unit testing and test automation frameworks
  • Kotlin experience would be a nice to have
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with business users and key project stakeholders
  • Possess some experience in Supervisory role

Bonus points if you have:

  • Worked on apps used by millions of people
  • A BS/MS in Computer Science or Engineering from a top school, but a wonderful project list trumps all
  • Prior start-up experience is awesome (not necessary); being scrappy will help you hit the ground running.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:

Their technology first approach is modernizing an otherwise stale industry, from IOT monitoring devices to our PEAN stack to our industry leading software. Led by a CEO with one startup success already under his belt and head of engineering with successful exists from both Zynga and SquareTrade (1.43 billion acquisition), we're rapidly expanding the team to join our talented, close knit team here in downtown Mountain View.

After taking on additional funding the company is looking to hire 90 full-time engineers (all levels- Backend, Frontend & Full-stack) in 2019.

We're looking for a talented Senior Software Engineers to help us grow the product line and expand across the United States. An ideal candidate brings leadership, maturity and a deep understanding of the software development life cycle.

Responsibilities:

● Work with a small, cross functional team on products and features to drive growth

● Build user friendly highly scalable, fault tolerant solutions across our industry disrupting product portfolio

● Elevate our technology and best practices through partnership with the Head of Engineering and other tech leaders

● Join stakeholder groups to guide engineering wide initiatives (security, devops, infrastructure, agile, hiring, etc)

● Mentor and lead less senior engineers

Required Qualifications:

● 5+ years professional experience as a full stack engineer on web applications and services

● 2+ years of experience with NodeJS or similar backend scripting technology

● 2+ years of experience with a modern front end framework (React, AngularJS, etc)

● Experience working with database systems (such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB)

Compensation & Perks:

● Generous medical, dental, vision, 401K, FSA account, commuter benefits including free parking pass, and others.

● Fully stocked kitchen & AMAZINGLY GOOD in-house BBQ Friday’s

● Work and play with super smart, friendly people in a high energy office in downtown Mountain View!!

title: Software Development Engineer
description:
Lake Shore Cryotronics is an international leader in developing innovative measurement and control solutions, primarily for scientific applications. Our equipment is often used to characterize physical properties of early stage electronic and magnetic materials.

Our Software Development Engineers are high-caliber, self-motivated professionals with a passion for designing, developing, and testing software in a fast-paced agile team environment. The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in using their skills to help advance the state of science that benefits mankind, as this is Lake Shore's mission.

Some Primary Duties Include:

-Developing software primarily using C#/.NET in Visual Studio, and occasionally in other similar languages (VB.NET, Java, Python) in a Windows environment, targeting either desktop (Windows Forms / WPF) or mobile (Xamarin / Xamarin.Forms)

-Writing clean, readable, self-documenting code using proven software development principles such as SOLID

-Writing unit tests sufficient to balance high quality with high efficiency

-Participating in a Scrum development process with a cross-functional team, providing feedback into the process for continuous improvement

-Performing sustaining engineering, manufacturing, and service support for existing product lines as required

-Developing and maintaining Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) pipelines using Azure DevOps, and other related technologies

-Developing and performing software verification and validation Quality Assurance (QA) testing

-Using GIT code repository system, following prescribed branching strategies

-Actively growing your design capability; taking ownership of your career providing regular self-evaluations and development plans

-Keeping up with the state of the art of software development by attending conferences, reading publications, and/or participating in relevant organizations

Qualified candidates will possess the following:

-Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science Engineering, or similar, with 0 – 5 years of relevant experience

-Experience with C#/.NET and Visual Studio

-Experience with unit testing frameworks and related technologies

-Experience with Xamarin / Xamarin.Forms technologies a plus

-Experience with Scrum or similar agile methodologies a plus

-Experience using GIT a plus

-Experience with CI / CD and other DevOps concepts, particularly using Azure DevOps a plus

Lake Shore Cryotronics is located in Westerville, a northeast suburb of Columbus OH and offers a work-life balance with challenging assignments, a focus on health and wellness, social activities, and community outreach. We are privately held and celebrating our 50th year in business.

We offer our employees a competitive compensation and benefits package (Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, and more). We are a recognized ColumbusCEO Top Workplace and a drug and tobacco free company.

Learn more about Lake Shore Cryotronics by visiting our website at www.lakeshore.com – and also visit our Facebook and LinkedIn sites.

Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

title: Front-end / Full-stack Software Engineer
description:
About Hazel Analytics

Hazel Analytics pairs the largest food safety inspection database with powerful analytics tools and solutions for Fortune 500s and leading organizations in the restaurant, financial services, government, and education industries. Our Food Safety Insights (FSI) and other analytics products transform diffuse and disparate local health department data into actionable intelligence using our proprietary Hazel Score methodology.

Of the top 100 food retail chains by size, 45 are users of Hazel Analytics technology; our customers include notable national and global brands such as Cheesecake Factory, Chick-fil-A, Target, Subway, and Whole Foods. Hazel Analytics is also the proud recipient of Jack in the Box's 2016 Food Safety Innovation Award.

About the position

We're currently seeking experienced full-stack and front-end engineers to continue growing our engineering team. We're looking for candidates with diverse tech experience to join us in both expanding our flagship product and creating new products, working across all levels of Hazel's tech stack. Our tech stack is predominantly Python (Flask), JavaScript (React), and PostgreSQL, with Docker and Google Cloud featuring in our infrastructure. Our team operates in an agile manner, keeping processes to a minimum and enabling engineers to stay focused on their work. We're especially interested in people who are eager to mentor junior engineers and who have recent experience with React/Redux, recent experience in data science, a devops focus, or UI/UX design skills.

Compensation is $100K - $160K + 0.05% - 1% equity (DOE).

Qualifications

Full-stack engineers

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a field related to software development
  • 4+ years of relevant career experience (2+ positions preferred)
  • Meaningful recent experience with JavaScript, Python, and SQL
  • Experience with cloud environments
  • Enthusiasm for unit tests and robust APIs

Front-end engineers

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a field related to software development
  • 4+ years of relevant career experience (2+ positions preferred)
  • Meaningful recent experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (especially React/Redux)
  • Enthusiasm for unit tests and robust APIs

Responsibilities

  • Implement new features and maintain existing features of Hazel software
  • Support features with tests, instrumentation, and documentation
  • Respond to customer escalations as needed
  • Collaborate on gathering requirements for features and identifying areas of risk or uncertainty
  • Contribute to improvements in team-wide processes, communication, and organization

title: Senior Front-end Engineer (Contract to Perm) - Remote or NY
description:
We are looking for bright, energetic and seasoned front-end engineers to join our team at Conductor. The successful candidate will be primarily focused on building and maintaining Javascript-based libraries, modules and applications. You will be expected to have the passion to champion best practices and build scalable services to support all functions of the business including analytics for data visualizations and reporting.

Our Engineering Values:

  • Collaboration: We believe that engineers do their best work when working together in cohesive teams.
  • Excellence: We believe in doing things the "right way" rather than the "fast way", and holding ourselves to a high standard of excellence.
  • Growth: We believe engineers do their best work when they are constantly growing, learning, and changing.
  • Communication: We believe in combining empathy with openness and honesty to set clear expectations and hold each other accountable.
  • Impact: We believe we're making the world a better place by empowering marketers to really help their customers rather than just sell stuff.

What You'll Do:

  • Design, develop, document, and deploy standalone JavaScript apps using React and Redux
  • Level up velocity, quality, and user experience by helping us improve the paradigms, patterns, and practices of front-end development at Conductor
  • Collaborate with engineers on your team, on other development teams, and on the Product and design teams
  • Refactor and re-architect existing code to comply with modern practices and tools

Who You Are:

  • You have 5+ years of professional experience building web apps with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML.
  • You have at least one year of professional experience with React, and at least one year with Redux or some similar state management library.
  • You have professional experience with tools for testing, compiling, building, and managing JS web applications, such as Mocha, Karma, npm, webpack, Babel, UglifyJS, etc.
  • You have professional experience working on a large web app with extensive CSS, and with at least one CSS preprocessor such as Sass, Less, or Stylus
  • You are fluent in JavaScript fundamentals and patterns. For example, you know what the call stack and event loop are, and you can explain the relationship between promises and async/await.
  • You are proactive. When you see something that can be fixed, improved, or optimized, you don't wait for someone else to do it.

Why You Should Join:

At Conductor, we are looking for engaged and passionate engineers that can raise the bar. There is a tremendous opportunity here to have immediate impact in the day-to-day and affect the company's success and growth. We all share in the same values and push each other to meet these standards.

We are made up of a diverse group of people from all backgrounds and include a team of exceptional engineers in Kyiv as well. Wherever you are from, you will find a common ground here for continuing to push forward your career and make a difference in this industry.

Conductor, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

About Conductor:

Conductor’s search and content intelligence platform helps marketers create and optimize content to improve visibility online.

The technology generates customer intent insights that lead to compelling content, increased traffic, and higher organic marketing ROI. Customizable dashboards and workflows guide marketers through the content creation process, empowering them to measure, refine, and demonstrate the effectiveness of their SEO and content marketing efforts.

In addition to its SaaS platform, Conductor offers a suite of services and support including site audits, site migrations, and managed services that empower in-house marketing teams and digital marketing agencies to drive results and put their customers' needs first.

Conductor's forward-thinking customers include global and emerging enterprise brands like Citibank, Salesforce, ClassPass, and WeWork.

title: Data Architect
description:
Data Architect

TELECOMMUTER OPERATIONS – IT OPERATIONS FULL TIME

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) is the nation’s leading women’s health care provider, educator, and advocate, serving women, men, teens and families. For over 100 years, PPFA has done more than any other organization in the United States to improve women’s health and safety, prevent unintended pregnancies, and advance the right and ability of individuals and families to make informed and responsible health care decisions.

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) seeks a dynamic and effective Data Architect. The incumbent will be tasked with the design and implementation of data solutions that support the Business Intelligence needs of PPFA and the overall data architecture of PPFA technology systems. In addition, the chosen candidate will be responsible for defining data standards and models for warehouse architectures and should have experience analyzing system requirements and implementing migration methods for existing data.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Responsible for evaluating and leading the selection of all infrastructure components related to data management, including, but not limited to: software, platform(s), relational database management systems, ETL software, metadata management tools. In partnership with IT, BI, Development, and other key stakeholders identify the optimum database design solutions. Develop database architectural strategies at the modeling, design and implementation stages that meet business or industry requirements. Manages crisis situations and responses that involve complex technical hardware and software challenges. Produce ETL design guidelines to ensure data integrity and management of the ETL infrastructure for the Business Intelligence system(s). Lead the integration efforts in merging BI platforms with enterprise systems and applications. Design conceptual and logical data models and data flows. Facilitate and support system feasibility studies, proof of concepts, pilot project(s) and testing. Define, develop and institute robust, quality processes to implement data changes and database modifications. Working with partners across IT and Information Security, ensure the integrity and security of PPFA’s data systems. Monitor and enforce license agreements using appropriate tools and processes.

REQUIREMENTS / TECHNICAL EXPERTISE Bachelors’ degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or equivalent. 5+ years of relevant experience, gathering and analyzing system requirements. Knowledge of data mining and segmentation techniques. Familiarity with data visualization tools.

PERSONAL QUALITIES /OTHER ATTRIBUTES Collaborative work style; able to facilitate amongst diverse communities and individuals; can inspire top performance in others; willingness to pitch in/ jump in. Able to translate technical concepts and ideas into relatable language for less technical stakeholders and audiences. Comfortable being an individual contributor and / or part of a team when work requires. Experienced mentoring and coaching support staff. Comfortable in ambiguity; able to create clarity and understanding. Experienced in getting to “yes” in a collaborative, consensus driven style. Enjoys operating in a fast-paced and demanding environment; a nimble and flexible style. A direct and open style; creative, out-of-the- box thinker that can translate concepts and ideas to broader audience. Deep appreciation for mission of PPFA. Diplomatic style; and high emotional intelligence. Integrity, independent thinking, and personal courage.

TRAVEL 0-25%

*LI-ES1

Planned Parenthood Federation of America is an equal employment opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a non-discriminatory work environment, and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Planned Parenthood is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation.

title: NoSQL Architect, Apple Pay
description:

Are you interested in solving the most complex and high scale Big Data challenges in the world today? title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
JOB SUMMARY (

Purposeful, practical and principled. BeckWay Group, a leading execution platform for middle-market private equity firms and their portfolio companies, is looking for a Senior Software Engineer candidate who is passionate about delivering high value to complex opportunities. We are seeking professionals who have the combination of aptitude, ambition and intellectual interest that typically predicts success at BeckWay Group. This is an opportunity to be the first full-time technology team member at a funded, early-stage SaaS startup. We are looking to hire a full-stack Senior Software Engineer with 5+ years of experience, preferably in building cloud-based web applications for enterprise clients. We are looking for an entrepreneur/builder that is excited about building a great software product AND a great software business. Ideally, this individual is someone who can eventually build and lead a team. This is simultaneously a leadership and a “roll-up-your-sleeves” role – no task is beneath you. Let us quickly deal with the topic of compensation. Our philosophy on this is to compensate you enough to take the issue of money off the table. A good starting point will be understanding your expectations and taking a look at industry benchmarks for the role. We agree on what is fair, and then we move forward. Now, on to what research suggests are the real drivers for motivation: autonomy, mastery, and purpose.

Autonomy – Our desire to be self-directed. “It doesn’t make sense to hire smart people and tell them what to do; we hire smart people so they can tell us what to do.” Steve Jobs

  • We want and expect you to think like an owner – this is your product, this is your business. You will make important decisions based on hypotheses, research, and data. You will make mistakes. Own them, learn from them, teach others. We know that the right person will thrive.
  • You can work 100% remote in the near-term, but this may change (100% -> 60%?) when the team scales and it is more efficient to work together. We have WeWork licenses that we can use whenever we want to co-locate. There is no office facetime requirement. There will be some travel as we are a client-driven business.

Mastery – Our urge to get better at stuff. “Train people well enough so they can leave, but treat them well enough so they don’t want to.” Richard Branson

  • You will be helping to build a SaaS tool, a team, and a business nearly from scratch. Pretty insane and steep learning curves along multiple dimensions.
  • We realize that in tech, you need to be constantly learning. We hope that you are intellectually curious and enjoy learning. We are happy to discuss any training opportunities that you think will help you develop your skill sets.

Purpose – Our desire for a higher, transcendent meaning in our life and work. “True happiness is not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.” Helen Keller

  • Increase happiness: Our hope is that we will develop technology products that benefit humanity. By helping our client’s employees see the link between what they do every day and their company’s strategy, we aspire to create a more engaged and happier workforce.
  • Increase value: Our software helps our clients execute strategic projects more efficiently thus creating more valuable businesses.

JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience/Knowledge Requirements: 5+ years of relevant work experience – can you create amazing user-focused tech that is difficult to copy? Show us!

  • Education/Technical Requirements: Computer science or related engineering degree from a top engineering school (Masters+ preferred)

  • Special Information: Some travel is expected to attend to quarterly BeckWay Group offsites but expected to be no more than 10% of time and all domestic.

title: Software Solutions Architect - Remote
description:
Citrusbyte is a team of experts who set sound principles and best practices into action. Our team solves complex problems and builds amazing things for some of the largest global household names. We work with team members around the world and have offices in LA and New York. This is a remote first role.

This role will require some travel to client sites as necessary. You must be authorized to work in the United States.

As Software Solutions Architect, you are a polyglot engineer with a hunger for learning new languages and tools. You see yourself as a maker and you are interested in all steps of the process, from understanding the challenge, to designing, developing and deploying.

As a consulting Software Solutions Architect, you are always happy to be learning, choosing the right tool for the job but also becoming the foremost domain expert about our client’s business. You should always be able to answer the question: What have I learned this week?

Responsibilities and Duties:

In this role, you will participate in the full life cycle of application development for our clients with duties including but not limited to:

  • Assist the sales team with uncovering and understanding technical requirements and producing estimates and risk assessments for new projects.
  • Become the domain expert for our clients’ business and gain a deep knowledge of their infrastructure and internal systems.
  • Assess and research technologies to determine their fitness for a particular purpose.
  • Educate and train clients and stakeholders about the benefits of our approach and process to software and solutions development.
  • Collaborate with the engineering team on project delivery by contributing code and reviewing pull requests.
  • Collaborate with the team to create a successful project hand-off plan

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 10+ years of experience in software engineering.
  • Over 5+ years of experience directly consulting with clients.
  • Eager to learn new languages and technologies.
  • Proficient and experienced with at least 3 programming languages; JavaScript, Ruby, Elixir, Go, C# and Python are all a plus.
  • Strong experience designing and delivering features on both server and client sides of the development stack.
  • Experience with AWS, GCP, or Azure.
  • Experience working with Chef, Ansible, and other provisioning technologies is a plus.
  • BS of Computer Science or similar academic background is a plus.
  • Excellent skills in spoken and written English language.
  • Possess a strong and reliable internet connection.

Benefits at Citrusbyte:

While we have offices in LA and New York, we work remotely with team members around the world

  • Remote first - Work from your remote location if you are not called to travel to client site
  • Team retreats - We get together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play
  • Healthy body, healthy mind - happy team - We offer vacation and support healthy lifestyles through our physical fitness and continuing education benefits program.

Citrusbyte expects team members to be honest, trustworthy, and operate with integrity. Discrimination and all unlawful harassment (including sexual harassment) in employment is not tolerated. We encourage success based on our individual merits and abilities, and all decisions regarding recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, skills development decisions such as training, and all other terms and conditions of our relationship, will be made without regard to race, nationality, national origin, citizenship status, employment engagement status, ethnicity, ethnic origin, color, creed, religion, belief, age, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender identity, sexual preference, lifestyle, social class, military status, disability, physical features, or any other protected status. We oppose all forms of unlawful or unfair discrimination.

Citrusbyte is an equal opportunity employer.

No statements by Citrusbyte are intended to create an offer of employment unless made in a writing signed by an officer of the company and no offer shall become effective unless countersigned by the prospective employee.

title: Software Engineer - Big Data
description:
Join our agile, cross-functional development team to push forward our Big Data ambitions, using the Hadoop ecosystem and technologies like MapReduce, Flink, Hive and Kafka. You will design and implement systems in a distributed environment to prepare, provide and analyze huge amounts of data.

Your mission:

  • Real- and near-time processing of our more than 1,500,000,000 daily game events
  • Preparing very large amounts of data (ETL) as a basis for further processing in other systems (e.g. Business Intelligence, CRM) using a range of technologies, including SQL (Hive), Flink and Kafka
  • Providing high-availability, centralized systems and services (REST APIs) for our games as well as solutions for subject-specific analysis requirements (e.g. multivariate testing), using technologies like Dropwizard or the Play framework.

Your profile:

  • You have completed your training as an IT specialist, a university degree in computer science or an equivalent qualification
  • Experience in object-oriented programming in Java and at least one other script or programming language (e.g. Bash, PHP, Scala, Go), ideally in an agile environment
  • You enjoy working with large amounts of data in distributed systems and you have very good knowledge of SQL
  • You know your way around the command line of UNIX operating systems
  • Ideally, you develop in a test-driven manner and use the advantages of a continuous integration server (e.g. Jenkins) for deployment
  • As the perfect candidate, you have already gained some experience with Big Data technologies, especially with the Hadoop ecosystem
  • You like to share a good laugh with your colleagues
  • Good English language skills complete your profile

Why join us?

  • Shape the success story of InnoGames with a great team of driven experts in an international culture
  • You will work in a multicultural Kanban-based team with daily stand ups and regular retrospectives
  • Work in a relaxed but solution-oriented and productive environment with clear goals and a focus on professional development
  • A great company culture: we strive for long term, sustainable success. We provide and accept feedback to improve others and ourselves
  • Professional education through developer conferences, unlimited free textbooks and frequent specialist presentations from your colleagues
  • We have regular team events (e.g. curling, cooking, paintball), BBQ together on our roof terrace and have a team lunch each Wednesday
  • You can set up your workspace as you wish: Mac or Linux, two or more monitors, a free choice of IDE as well as other software
  • We pay a share of your local public transportation ticket and even contribute to your company retirement plan
  • Exceptional benefits ranging from flawless relocation support to company gym, smartphone or tablet of your own choice for personal use, roof terrace with BBQ and much more
  • We have fun at work!

Excited to start your journey with InnoGames and join our dynamic team as a Software Engineer – Big Data? We look forward to receiving your application as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible start date through our online application form. Isabella Dettlaff would be happy to answer any questions you may have.

InnoGames, based in Hamburg, is one of the leading developers and publishers of online games with more than 200 million registered players around the world. Currently, more than 400 people from 30 nations are working in the Hamburg-based headquarters. We have been characterized by dynamic growth ever since the company was founded in 2007. In order to further expand our success and to realize new projects, we are constantly looking for young talents, experienced professionals, and creative thinkers.

title: Full-Stack Developer
description:
We’re looking for a creative Full-Stack Developer comfortable in writing beautiful, modern and world class-apps for iOS/Android to join our Malmö team. We’re looking for a colleague that is humble, curious and want to learn and grow together with others, every day. As part of a small and robust team of developers, you will work very closely with our UX team to deliver products and services that make a difference.

About us

We at Above are devoted to breaking down the boundaries between physical and digital solutions with the fusion of hardware, software, applications and services. We work with the full scale of product and service creation, from strategic concepting all the way through to manufacturing.

We are a mixed bag, not only nationalities but also of competencies. Made up of industrial, digital- and service designers, mechanical, electrical- and software engineers split over three offices - Stockholm, Malmö and Shenzhen.

One of our core philosophies is that we believe in bringing designers and engineers together from the start. When our designers understand the state of the art tech-enablers and our engineers get the big picture, the user experience moves from a vision into the market – and beyond, creating value in people’s everyday lives.

We work with amazing international brands, local Scandinavian heroes and a fantastic collection of startups. We also have a passion for creating our own products and have a good track record of successful start-up ventures. We’re a team of warm, welcoming, dedicated professionals that love to build cool stuff. In everything we do, we strive for a world class result and believe you share that mindset.

About the position

As a Full-Stack Software Developer, you will be working daily with Visual designers, Service designers, UX designers, Embedded developers and much more. We believe tight integration between a broad range of disciplines together with a mix of nationalities and personalities results in better products as well as a fun and dynamic workplace.

As an important member of a small and passionate team, you will have a lot of influence on our app building strategy and workflow. You will be part of all phases in product development, all the way from understanding the user and doing concept design to shipping experiences to real users. You will be able to take responsibility for the work you do and in the end to be proud of what we create together. Ideally, you have worked with both Android and iOS professionally a few years, but eagerness to learn can make up for a lot.

So, the mandatory skills we would be super glad if you had:

  • Experience with app development using React Native
  • Experience with backend development using Node.js
  • Experience with TypeScript
  • GIT, build systems, testing tools etc
  • Ability to translate product requirements and user needs into human, readable code that is easy to maintain and evolve
  • Hands-on, persistent, result-oriented, and humble — you get things done
  • Stimulated by collaborating with a team to define, design and ship new features

Things we think are cool for you to have, but aren't deal breakers

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Experience with graphic design programs (Photoshop/Illustrator)
  • Experience with wire-framing/mockup tools (InVision/Sketch)
  • Experience with native mobile development
  • Experience with back-end, server-side MVC architecture
  • Demonstrable experience on past projects (via Github, BitBucket, Google Code, etc).
  • A candidate with an active commit history at a site like these will be favored over a candidate without a similar history.
  • Awareness of the latest libraries and tendencies (React.js, Vue.js, Redux, etc.)
  • Working knowledge of modern cross-browser HTML5, ES6/7, and CSS3/4

Interested?

If you have any questions regarding the job position, send an email to Marcus Matèrn, Software & Hardware Manager, at marcus@above.se, and if you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please send an email to our HR Manager Linda Petersson at linda@above.se

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
Network Next | Full Stack Software Engineer | Santa Monica, CA | Full-Time | Onsite | $100-150k USD, up to 1% equity

Do you love helping game developers create great multiplayer experiences?

Founded in 2017 by game developers and networking pros, and backed by $4.5M in seed investment, Network Next is creating the internet fast lane for games, a network that delivers the best multiplayer experiences possible.

With our technology, real-time applications purchase high performance, low-latency routes on our neutral marketplace—every 10 seconds. You’ll be working with Google Cloud Platform, Kubernetes, Go, C/C++, TypeScript and React.

Are you a Full Stack Software Engineer ready to fix the Internet for games? Join us in Santa Monica where you'll help game developers deliver amazing multiplayer experiences.

What you will do:

As part of your role at Network Next, you will:

  • Work with customers to ensure Network Next delivers the performance and quality characteristics required by their game or application.
  • Develop our Go/Kubernetes backend stack to enable us to meet our exponentially growing traffic needs.
  • Develop the React/TypeScript frontend to allow game developers and network suppliers to analyze, debug and optimize network traffic.
  • Address high priority production issues raised internally or by our customers on a rotating, on-call basis.
  • Improve our continuous integration and deployment pipeline to iterate and ship new features, quickly and reliably.
  • Continuously identify, break down, and prioritize upcoming work to enable Network Next to quickly deliver the highest value improvements for our customers.

What it’s like at Network Next:

You’ll join a diverse team with experience from a wide range of backgrounds, who care deeply about work-life balance and delivering value to our customers.

  • Located within walking distance of the Santa Monica pier, there’s plenty of nearby places to grab a coffee or lunch.
  • Flexible working hours—most people work in the office from 10AM–5PM, with remote as needed.
  • Unlimited PTO—and we mean it. If you feel like taking time away from work, you’re encouraged to do so.
  • “Work from home” Fridays. Whether you’re working from home, or finding a nice coffee shop to work out of, we work away from the office on Fridays so we can be productive anywhere.
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance, a company funded 401k with 5% matching, a conference budget and generous hardware/software allowance, and rapid career growth opportunities.

Compensation: $100k–$150k USD, with up to 1% equity.

Things we look for:

  • You have experience working within the Linux environment.
  • You’ve worked in Go, TypeScript and C++ before, or you’re a polyglot engineer who can quickly pick up new programming languages.
  • You understand networking protocols and in particular UDP.
  • You've built and deployed applications at scale, and have a deep understanding of the reliability challenges facing large-scale deployments.
  • You have strong critical thinking skills, and can make sound decisions with limited information.
  • You have solid communication and interpersonal skills. You can validate and communicate decisions clearly to the team, and with customers.
  • Bonus: Experience with one or more of the following technologies: Google Cloud Platform, gRPC, Cloud Datastore, Bigtable, Kubernetes, BigQuery, Redis, React.
  • Bonus: You’ve written your own networking protocols before, or have experience implementing game networking.
  • Bonus: You have been involved in project planning and scheduling, prioritizing tasks and have an economical focus on delivering the most value for customers.
  • Bonus: Development experience with game consoles, including Sony Playstation, Microsoft XBox One or the Nintendo Switch.

These aren’t hard requirements, and if you don't feel like you meet everything listed above, we encourage you to apply anyway. Above everything else, we’re looking for talented individuals who want to make the Internet better for games.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
